page.title: 07Employment, Clayton-le-Woods
page.content: Apart from the Royal Ordnance PLC factory in the south west of the area there are no large scale industries in the district. Most people who live here work outside the area and commute to work daily in the surrounding towns. There is a good network of motorways for journeys to Preston, Lancaster, Manchester, Liverpool and Wigan. The workers at the ROF come in from the surrounding areas and many are carried by a private fleet of coaches. Many temporary jobs have been created in the building industry by the development of new housing areas and their associated roads and services. East of the M61, outside the New Town boundary, the main source of employment is still farming.
